title: Fix documentation URL mismatch in pyproject.toml
description:
**As a** potential contributor or user
**I want** consistent documentation URLs across the project
**So that** I can easily find the official documentation

**Context:**
pyproject.toml currently points to `https://consoul.readthedocs.io` but README.md and all documentation references use `https://consoul.goatbytes.io`. This creates confusion and broken links.

**Technical Notes:**
- File: `pyproject.toml` lines 110, 128
- Current: `Documentation = "https://consoul.readthedocs.io"`
- Correct: `Documentation = "https://consoul.goatbytes.io"`
- Also check `documentation` field in `[tool.poetry]` section

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** the pyproject.toml file
**When** I check the documentation URLs
**Then** all URLs point to https://consoul.goatbytes.io

**Given** a user visits pypi.org/project/consoul
**When** they click the documentation link
**Then** they land on the correct documentation site

**Testing Considerations:**
- Verify URL in both [project.urls] and [tool.poetry] sections
- Check that MkDocs site is actually deployed at consoul.goatbytes.io
- Confirm PyPI metadata will update on next publish

**Implementation Hints:**
- Update line 110: `Documentation = "https://consoul.goatbytes.io"`
- Update line 128: `documentation = "https://consoul.goatbytes.io"`
- Verify with: `poetry build` and check PKG-INFO

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content: Successfully fixed documentation URLs in pyproject.toml. Changed both [project.urls] and [tool.poetry] documentation fields from https://consoul.readthedocs.io to https://consoul.goatbytes.io. Verified with grep and committed.
